review.title: Solving a Path Planning Problem in a Partially Known Environment using a Swarm Algorithm
review.abstract: This paper proposes a path planning strategy for an Autonomous Ground Vehicle (AGV) navigating in a partially known environment. Global path planning is performed by first using a spatial database of the region to be traversed containing selected attributes such as height data and soil information from a suitable spatial database. The database is processed using a biomimetic swarm algorithm that is inspired by the nest building strategies followed by termites. Local path planning is performed online utilizing information regarding contingencies that affect the safe navigation of the AGV from various sensors. The simulation discussed has been implemented on the open source Player-Stage-Gazebo platform.
histories: IEEE International Symposium on Measurements and Control in Robotics. 2008
review.COMMENTS: IEEE International Symposium on Measurements and Control in Robotics. 2008

metadata.title: Solving a Path Planning Problem in a Partially Known Environment using a Swarm Algorithm

sections.text: The design of a complete planner that calculates a collision-free path for a non-holonomic robot in a partially known environment, especially outdoors, is constrained by a number of factors, including the number of degrees of freedom imposed by the geometry of the robot, the presence or absence of obstacles and sensor inaccuracies [1] that cause an exponential increase in the computational complexity of the problem [2]. A strategy to reduce the complexity of the problem is to formulate assumptions that simplify the environment [3], [4], [5]. Another strategy is to design planners that satisfy weaker forms of the complexity of the problem, such as the probablistic map [8] and the randomized map.

sections.heading: II. THE SWARM ALGORITHM
sections.text: This year, the time has come for an agreement to be reached, and it will only take a few days.

sections.heading: III. LOCAL PATH PLANNING
sections.text: In this context, it should be noted that this is a very complex and complex matter.

sections.heading: ACKNOWLEDGMENT
sections.text: The authors thank Director CAIR for their support of this work.
